WorkItem.Description:
Similar as Issue # 9259. (So I explicitely vote for that too, since I made that same adjustment.)
When the user pushes f.e. a Commit or Cancel button, the current cell - with possibly invalid input - looses focus, but simply cannot leave editmode (in either ways).
I do not use commands there, and all my editable columns/cells are templated columns.
Did also not test this with the march release. From some dry testing I concluded that it must work in the same way.
My current - copy and paste - solution in a attachment.

Comments.Message: Hi Eric.  I believe this is the same bug as 9259.  If so, it will not be fixed in the march release.  We have filed a bug in our internal database for this.

Hi brandf,

It is not exactly the same - other part of the code (other method). 
The similarity however is that there isn't a current cell. So when you succeed in a solution preventing that from occurring, you are right. So current cell would in that case be the (last) active cell. "My attached solution" (maybe workaround is a better phrase) alternatively searches for the row being edited. I added a simple ugly copied-pasted "else" for that.

Best regards,

Eric Gehring
www.softex.nl
